meanings.definition: The quality or state of being maidenly.
meanings.sent1: Her maidenlinesses shone through in her modesty and grace.
meanings.sent2: The village admired her maidenlinesses, evident in her gentle manners.
meanings.sent3: At the ball, her maidenlinesses caused quite a stir among the young suitors.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a display of colorful flowers, each representing a different aspect of maidenlinesses.
meanings.sent5: In the painting, the artist captured the essence of maidenlinesses with delicate brushstrokes.

meanings.definition: The characteristics or attributes of a maiden.
meanings.sent1: The fairy tale described the maidenlinesses of the princess in great detail.
meanings.sent2: In the medieval era, certain qualities were associated with maidenlinesses.
meanings.sent3: The play humorously exaggerated the maidenlinesses of the young heroine.
meanings.sent4: Her room was decorated with items that reflected the essence of maidenlinesses.
meanings.sent5: The novel portrayed the protagonist's journey to discover her own maidenlinesses.

meanings.definition: The behavior or demeanor of a young unmarried woman.
meanings.sent1: She carried herself with the maidenlinesses expected of a lady of her status.
meanings.sent2: The etiquette class focused on teaching the girls proper maidenlinesses.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, the young women showcased their maidenlinesses in traditional dances.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph captured the group of friends giggling with youthful maidenlinesses.
meanings.sent5: Her speech at the conference was filled with confidence and maidenlinesses.
